review: My family and I ate at Red Robin last night. The service was good. The wait staff was accommodating and attentive. The food was mediocre at best. The bacon on my burger was limp and lifeless. My sweet potato fries seemed to have been cooked hours before they were served to me.   This is the second bad experience at a Red Robin in a row. Good service does not make up for bad food. Don't believe I'll go back

Red Robin is one of our standards and usually everything is just fine, including tonight. A few too many "how is everything?" interruptions, but the food was exactly what we ordered and tasted great. I loved the server's recommendation to try the ciabatta bun - I ate half of it and it was better than a "plain" bun. One of our reasons for going there is they offer gluten-free but we were told tonight that a gluten-free bun cost $1 more. I don't recall that from prior trips but perhaps we weren't told.  They're very careful with gluten-free customers and I applaud that. If a person is gluten allergic (I'm not), then a manager has to bring the food to that person. I just prefer gluten-free products but not for $1. Really, that's unnecessary. Again, we like the place. It's always clean, usually fast (not always so at lunch, which is surprising but tonight was great) and accurate and they refill our drinks and fries without our having to ask. They even offer a to-go cup of diet soda if we want one. Good service, meals that are always up to expectations and a reasonable price.

Good chain restaurant. I have always ordered their veggie burger and added guacamole; but you can actually substitute a veggie patty for any burger on their menu. They've recently changed their veggie burger from having the "regular" toppings like lettuce and tomato to caramelized onions and grilled zucchini. It was tasty! Their appetizers are well priced and you can get a single order of mozzarella sticks for about $3. Rootbeer floats and milkshakes are about the same price as sodas.

I went to Red Robin a few years ago and wasn't impressed with the food and hadn't been back in a while. I decided to go all out tonight and get a 3 course meal. The appetizer was a pick two of onion rings and fried zucchini. The onion rings were yummy and the zucchini, not so much. For my meal, I ordered a burger with onion straws, horseradish mushrooms, provolone, and some sauce and it was so huge I could hardly fit it in my mouth. It came with big fries as a side, and I will say, Red Robin does know its burgers. For dessert, I ordered the Mudpie. Think ice cream cake with chocolate and cookies and cream ice cream, cookie crusts, fudge, and whipped cream. Definitely big enough for two, or two helpings when you don't feel like sharing. Service was good, and I have a ton of leftovers.

We like the chain. It is very family friendly and our favorites are the pineapple-related sandwiches and burgers. The kids enjoy a very flexible variety of health side dishes, and the adults (OK, just me) like their hose seasoning.

Terrible service. Messed up my order twice before I told them to forget about it. My wife ended up eating lunch alone... We then asked for the check, for her meal, and it took them 10 minutes to get the manager to take my meal off the bill.  I think they should've given is my wife's meal on the house as well for all the trouble.  Won't ever go back to this Red Robin!!!!

Being from up North I knew what to expect, great food, great service, ENDLESS fries for the potato fans( I personally like to add the fry seasoning to mine). Love the addition of the Rewards Club. Take my family when they stop in, always end up with a FREE entree.

Went around 9:30 pm , waited bc they said they had to find seating for 8 . The place was almost empty?????? Took over 45 minutes to get food then the fries came out cold , burgers were burnt , we had little kids so we just ate it and asked for our checks . They did bring out more hot fries but it was so late we didn't eat them. We split the check one was with cash the other debit. Looks like the young staff chose to pocket my 40+ dollars and charge the debit card for both orders?! What a horrible first time experience for lil kids . First impressions are everything . Don't waste your money.

The burgers are clearly the star of this show. Our server was helpful with all the menu selections but after we ordered we didn't see much of him. We had to ask several other employees for refills and the special condiments we ordered. At the end of our meal we asked to have some of our plates removed. A bus person showed up with a bus tub and removed everything. Very unusual service. The food was delicious. Everyone loved the chili cheese fries. All of the burgers were hot, fresh piled high with toppings.  If you are ready for a great burger but don't mind poor service, then this place will be for you. I think it will be a while before we return.

Server is very nice. They ran out of sweet potato fries so a little disappointed about that. And right now been waiting for the check for around 5 minutes, 30 minute wait for table, 20 minute wait for soup.

The burgers outshine everything in this restaurant. The service in the bar area is terrible. We usually don't let them seat us in there but we made that mistake again. All the tables have this sticky feel to them, kind of gross. This should get at least a 4 star because of the burgers but their service lowered it. Not saying I'll never return though. Why such a small serving of fries now?

Burgers are good and the endless basket of fries is always nice but the service here is so poor it's not worth it. I don't care to waste a lot of time on this review, but every time I've been here, I've encountered the most in attentive staff.

Food is just like any other burger joint. Prices are average. Has plenty of seating room. Service is hit or miss depending on your waiter. One day I had excellent service. The other day I was seated by the hostess and no one came by the table for another 23 minutes and I finally had to get the hostess to take my order.

Service was slow, the food nothing remotely close to the food pictured or described. Dare to complain? You will be told "that's the way it is" I tried the location in Durham and liked it, but this one is one I will not be returning to.  Manager comes by after you are done eating, not much to show or do then.

I wish 0 stars was an option. I went to Red Robin at least 1 time per month back in 1991-2 when I lived in California. Over the years it's always been a "safe" stop in any city, especially with a young son. A burger and a beer, simple, easy. We decided to try the one in Greensboro about a year back when we moved here. Summary of 3 different visits: Visit 1: Waited 15 minutes to sit in a half-full restaurant. Finally ordered at the bar with my wife and son. Burgers took over 30 minutes to come out-this IS their specialty right? Visit 2: Ordered takeout and the order was completely messed up. Had to run back to get the right food. Visit 3: Restaurant is 1/2 full but there are at least 20 people waiting. We are told it will be 15 minutes. Empty tables with old meals sit everywhere. Finally we are seated after 30 minutes (too tired and late to go elsewhere). They seat us at a partially cleaned table-and finish cleaning. There is a steak bone that sits at the table next to us. We converse and are laughing with the other family sitting next to us. Nothing comes out right; all overcooked. We complain but nothing. Had left a message with corporate. Someone called our home phone but left no message (caller ID).  I hope the District Manager reads this (not the GM) as this is the worst Red Robin I've ever been too-and it's consistently bad. I'm not sure how they stay in business...

The burgers are pretty darn good. They are big and cone with the steak fries which are nothing to write home about. Service is quick and friendly. It's a bit pricey for a burger joint but worth it every once and a while.

I ordered chips, salsa, and guacamole on Wednesday night around 7:45 and they came out tasting stale. The guacamole was also brown and tasting like it was going bad. I ended up ordering a chilli burger with bottomless fries and it  took over 45 minutes before the server came and asked if I had reviewed my food yet. I ended up canceling the order and just paying for the chips and salsa. The server was really nice, but the experience just wasn't up to par with surrounding restaurants. No one came to apologize or make it right... I won't be going back.

Clayton is extraordinary, to say the least. I have been to Red Robin before and I never had such an amazing experience until I was served by Clayton, and get this; All he brought us was our drinks but he was such a joy in that short amount of time. People like Clayton are the people who make the restaurant experience worthwhile. My husband wanted to grill out today but I was like "no, let's go to Red Robin, honey". Best decision of my life. Wow. Awesome. Keep up the good work, Red Robin. The service was great, also. Shout out to Paris for that.

I definitely enjoy coming here. Being a server myself when I was younger I understand what these servers go through. I notice all of the asshole customers around and feel bad for the workers. I completely understand the wait times. I know that sometimes it is understaffed and one person cannot simply handle the stress of a lot of customers running them to death. If there were mor than 5 starts I would give it to this restaurant.

I decided to go to this location on my lunch break, which is a 15min drive from my work. Once I arrived, it took roughly 10min from the time I walked into the restaurant till someone actually took a drink order for me. Once my order was taken the food came out relatively quickly. I sat for at least 5 minutes before the manager came by and brought me silverware (my server had not checked on me). Then once I cut into my burger it was cooked well done and I had ordered it medium well. Now, this "gourmet" burger I had was the equivalent of a McDonald's $1 menu burger. It's really no wonder it was overcooked because it was so very thin! I had also asked for the relish to be on the side, which it was left off completely! When my server finally came by to check on me I informed her it was cooked improperly and she offered to have them do it again. By this time I had exactly enough time left to get back to work and so I declined and walked out. I will never ever eat at this restaurant and most certainly never this location again! Service was slow and on top of that, you can't even get what you order!

When I first experienced Red Robin it was great. The burgers were big and juicy, and the garlic fries were amazing. Ever since my first visit, overall quality has gone down hill. My husband and I decided to eat here mainly for some bottomless garlic fries. We were seated promptly, but I noticed there were about 3-4 waitresses around the Hostess area. They were all talking and laughing, and it pretty much stayed that way the entire visit. They would go take care of customers, but then come back to their little station to talk. The worst part was that a manager (who I assumed to be the manager was in the middle with them) After we were seated we ordered our drinks and we took a minute to decide. Our waitress was nice enough, but after she took our order and brought our food, we didn't really see much of her. She checked on us once after our food came out but she was almost nonexistent after that. The food itself was just ok. I ordered the mushroom swiss on texas toast with garlic fries. The burger was cooked as I ordered, toast was good, and mushrooms were seasoned with a lot of fresh garlic. However my fries were not good at all. Since when does Red Robin skimp on the fresh garlic for their garlic fries? What I got was fries with sprinkled garlic powder and grated parmesan. The garlic seasoning even tasted off. My husband ordered their new Nacho Crunch Burger with garlic fries as well. His fries were the same, but his burger was incredibly thin (almost to the standards of McDonalds.) We usually save half of our meal for dinner at night, but his burger was so thin it wasn't filling enough and he ate the whole thing. We came for bottomless fries but ended up not getting any. Our waitress finally showed up after we sat not eating/talking for about 5 minutes. We paid and left quickly. It's becoming apparent that Red Robin is cutting corners with their food and is turning into the type of restaurant that wants to get you in and out as quick as possible. There are plenty of other places around Greensboro you can go to for a better burger than here.

The raspberry limeade was a wonderful beginning to my lunch yesterday. I had a delicious bacon cheeseburger with pepper jack cheese and some fries. The burger was so filling & so tasty. It had a little kick from the pepper jack. I can't wait to get another raspberry limeade and one of those burgers!

Typical bar food.  Had the small wedge salad and it was very good.  Mary had the Tavern Burger and fries and enjoyed especially since it was free for her upcoming birthday.  I had the fish and chips but they were greasy and everything piled on top of each other.

There was a time that I frequented this restaurant often. Over time, my experiences have been disappointing. Even when the place is almost empty, the food takes forever to come out.  I was there this week for lunch a little after 1pm and there are very few people there. We ordered our food and patiently waited. After a longer than expected time we complained that our food and not arrived. After our food finally arrived the manager came by to explain that day try to get food out in nine minutes and ours took 19 and she was sorry. While her apology was appropriate she made no attempts to remediate the situation or  offer any discount of any kind. There are many local burger places that are far better such as big burger spot or hops.

We have not been to a Red Robin in about a year or more, and the last time was in NY. I think I rated it a 5-star. Today's visit was just "average" in my opinion. Cleanliness: I believe we arrived shortly after their lunch crowd left because the floors were filthy. Tons of food debris, used napkins, straw wrappers, etc littered the floor. It wasn't until we were about to leave that I saw an employee begin to start sweeping up the mess. Our table was kind of sticky as well. Atmosphere: Again, meh. I have been to a brand new RR before and it was classy... Almost "too fancy to be a RR." This location needs a definite update. The whole, "TV in the floor" upon walking in seems so dated and of course, it wasn't on anyways.  Food: I wasn't in the mood for a burger so I tried the California chicken sandwich and got it wrapped in lettuce instead of on a bun. It was pretty good. A little tough to eat on the lettuce but I managed. Like another Yelper mentioned, the "bottomless fries" was a measly portion. I only had one order brought out to me because I didn't want to feel like a pig asking for another but I could have gone for another 1-2 orders because there were so few given to me. I'm sure they do this to reduce waste because people probably ask for more and then don't eat them.  My husband got the Whiskey River Burger in a lettuce wrap... Originally the chicken version was brought out for him but the server caught that mistake before placing it in front of him. No big deal, the correct meal was delivered after a few more minutes. Again, he had a tough time with the lettuce wrap because it really wasn't a "wrap" it was more like 2 stacks of iceburg "buns" hence, when you'd bite into it, everything slipped out the backside. If it were actually WRAPPED in lettuce, it would have held it all in better. We ordered the meatball kids meal for our daughter with broccoli. The meatballs were pretty good. They came with these little breadsticks you could stab the meatball with to dunk it in the marinara sauce. She seemed to really enjoy them. The broccoli seemed to be not steamed enough... It was pretty hard still.  Service: Our server was ok. She was friendly but I felt like another server was at our table more than our actual one was. And after we were done eating, the bill was dropped and we waited sooooo long to have it picked back up... As our daughter was meting down because she wanted to leave .  All in all, I think I would try out another place around the area before returning to this RR location.

We hadn't been to Red Robin in awhile & thought we'd give this one a try since it's close to our new house... & we couldn't decide on a new place to eat.  The staff was incredibly friendly. Our waitress was kind, sweet to our little human & very helpful. However, the floors & tables were filthy. Trash, food & other junk everywhere. The table was sticky & just looked dirty. We ordered fairly quickly but getting our food took forever. I ordered the gourmet burger & it seriously tasted like something from McDonalds just with more lettuce, tomatoes & onions. Plus it was barely warm. Super disappointed... Will not be back.
Great service from our waitress Jengi aka Jumanji. We ordered the DGI burger and it was delicious. Only took 10 minutes after ordering to receive our meals. Around 2pm in a weekday.  Will come back.

We have eaten at Red Robin several times when we were out of town and I was craving  a really good burger and salad so we drove an hour away to go to Greensboro's Red Robin.   This was our first visit and it will be our last.  The place was busy and our waitress did her best but she was swamped.  So first there was not enough wait staff. Second we were told the corporate and a new mandate all kid families in the back and all adults in the bar and then stick the overflow anywhere. As an adult I would prefer not to be in the bar  and NOT to be surrounded by a bunch of kids.  Just let the mix flow.  We were overflow so we were stuck in the middle of the kid section, luckily there were no out of control kids as we have experienced before.   Food is where it really fell apart.  I ordered the A.1.® Peppercorn Burger,  no bun  and salad.  I got a see through patty with a slice of cheese and two slices of tomato,  nothing Gourmet burger  or five-star steakhouse about it.  I was so shocked!!  I ask the waitress wasn't it suppose to have mushrooms and she said no.  And left it at that.  She was right not mushrooms but it was suppose to have hardwood-smoked bacon and crispy onion straws.     Now I know this was a kitchen mistake BUT she should have know by looking that something was missing and at least checked after I ask.  My salad also had the wrong dressing  :(   This  was not a $50.00 meal for the 3 of us we should have gone to Five Guys.

Had a terrible experience tonight. Clearly understaffed, but no apologies for beers being first unavailable and then alternate selection delivered 30 minutes after we ordered. We were seated where we could see orders sitting under the heat lamps forever before being served. French fries were tasteless, Burger only a small step above McDonald's. Bill was wrong; again, no apology. Will not be back.
My Hubby & I ate there on 8/28/15 the Food was Good; or Average. The Service; Not so Good!! This used to be One of Our Favorite Places to Eat, but not sure anymore!!

Pitiful. That is the best word I can come up with to describe this restaurant today.  I'll start with the good- our waiter was friendly and helpful. Drinks and fry refills were brought to the table quickly.  Now for the bad.  My husband got one of their "double" burgers, which come with 2 smaller patties. This turned out to be about the amount of meat on a double burger from Wendy's, but with less flavor. I'm not sure why they ask for a preferred temperature with these burgers, because they will all inevitably come out well done. The fries on both the initial order and the single refill we got were cold. My spicy sombrero salad was more like a sad sombrero salad. The chicken came out burnt on one side- of course, it was the side on the bottom that they tried to hide from me. The salad was missing black beans, cilantro, lime wedge, and bell peppers. After pointing this out, beans and peppers were added but the other toppings were still nowhere to be found. To top it all off, the avocado was brown. I know this place serves enough avocado between burgers and salads that there is no reason it shouldn't be fresh. My son's mini corn dog poppers were ok, but to be fair, that's a really tough item to screw up since you just have to throw it in the fryer. Finally, the floor on the way to the bathroom was so slick, I almost fell down on the way there and back. Oh, and it would be nice if the doors all had functioning locking mechanisms.  All in all, a bad experience. We only came today because we had a birthday reward to use, but we won't be back.
Average, that is the best word to describe our meal here. Service was ok. The burger was fine but certainly nothing special. The fries were under seasoned.

I've always like Red Robin and this is the location I visit most often. The staff here is friendly and attentive on every visit so far. The restaurant is large and has its own style, right down to a television in the floor when you walk in. We opted to kick off the meal with pretzels with beer cheese. I was not disappointed, the flavor of the cheese rocked and the pretzels were soft and soaked it up nicely. For the main event, I opted to get the hottest burger Red Robin could throw at me, the firey ghost pepper tavern double. The burger was cooked perfectly, had a ton of flavor and was overall very delicious, but had virtually no heat. That's the issue I have with not just Red Robin, but most burger places I try. If I see ghost pepper/fire/volcano/molten/death in title of a burger, I want a my tongue to melt. The fries are awesome here, crisp, flavorful and my favorite part of all, ENDLESSLY ENDLESS. There were several sauces that you can choose from that are free for dipping,  and others with a small fee but more upscale ingredients.  Overall, I have not had a bad experience here, though it does hit me in the wallet abit hard being a bit overpriced. But as long as the service is consistent, burgers delicious and the fries ever flowing, I will return.

If this is where you are going for your burger fix in Greensboro, you're doing it wrong. Get back in your car and go a mile down the road to the original Big Burger Spot and enjoy a much better burger combo than what you would get at Red Robin. That said, you could certainly do worse. There is something to be said for bottomless French fries if you're really hungry. It also helps they are the big wedge style steak fries. Burgers here are pretty good, if it weren't for a wealth of other locally owned and operated burger boutiques I could see it being one of the better spots to enjoy some Angus goodness. But, since those places do exist, I wouldn't recommend Red Robin to you.

Lousy.  Grease is a musical, it's also on every plate.  Overrated burgers, and who wants bottomless fries unless you've a date with your undertaker.  That's if the waitress remembers to offer a 'refill' on that or your soft drinks.  Avoid - gourmet is a complete misnomer.

Ok, so it's basically a upper tier, fast food, burger restaurant that is just ok. I mean Greensboro is loaded with independently owned burger spots that are out of this world, so I certainly wouldn't make Red Robin a regular stop. After my last visit to any Red Robin, not just this one, I swore I'd never come again! Well wouldn't you know I got the Christmas gift card that said, "Your going back to Red Robin"! My problem in the past at all of them across the board is the bottomless fries campaign. It has always been a struggle to get them to bring back more fries without a long wait in between! I will say that this recent visit was quite different, with every request for additional fries being filled in a very reasonable fashion so that we weren't done with our meal and left with just fries! The burgers are indeed good, as well are the chicken sandwiches. They aren't anything to rave about, but not as bad as a meal at Applebee's for sure! Red Robin is the type of place to stop if your traveling somewhere and dread that pit stop at a McDonald's or Wendy's!

I am very disappointed with this place. when sitting at my table the surface was sticky and I could also see some dirty marks on the seats... asked two waiters to clean it and have been ignored.  Patties totally overcooked - guys a gourmet burger is tasting different! Appetizers ok. Love their onion rings... will for sure never come back...

I really enjoyed the Habanero burger I got here. Forget the name but the flavor was amazing. The disappointment was I ordered it MEDIUM. Came out almost well done. Some of my bottomless fries were over cooked slightly (turning white and transparent) So I'm not sure if they are sitting around pre-cooked in a heater. But there was only like 3 tables there, so why would they not cook fries to order? I don't understand honestly. That's just pure laziness.  This place has so much potential. I don't come to Greensboro a lot. But I'd be willing to try it again sometime. But someone mentioned a place called "big burger" under me. I might try that next time I'm in town and see how it is, before I gives this place another go. The Red Robin in Florida I went to was just a lot better overall. I mean, where's the passion? If you over cook a burger or fries you start over. It's fast food, it's the easiest menu.  Overall as a company I love them. Lots of unique stuff. I hope it gets better, but I probably wont try it for a few years, again because I'm hardly ever in the area. Edit: I forgot to mention, our waiter with the bald head was very attentive and friendly.

I decided I wanted to try Red Robin, because I saw a commercial on TV for the bottomless fries, and I was like, "I have to have those!"  I ate very little Saturday morning/afternoon because I was so ready to smash some bottomless fries.  My boyfriend and I got there probably around 5:30, so we were still a little ahead of the dinner rush.  There was a wait, but it wasn't very long- maybe 10 mins.  The lobby was spacious, and the pictures on the walls were entertaining enough to pass the time without watching the clock.  We were seated, and shortly after greeted by our server.  She was friendly enough.  They have little playmakers for you to do trivia on for a charge; we didn't partake in that because we still try to be frugal.  We didn't have an appetizer, again, preparing for the bottomless fries. When we ordered our food, I confirmed with our server that the fries were in fact bottomless (I wanted to make sure she understood why I was there and what was up.) My boyfriend and I each got burgers.  I got the burger with guacamole, bacon and mayo.  It was wonderful.  I like the colour of the beef, it was nicely presented and it tasted amazing.  The first thing I did was pour my fries out of the little metal thing it comes in, into my basket, and placed my fry container on the edge of the table, in my head, what would mean "I'd like more, please!"  She promptly ran by and grabbed up my fry thing, and kept moving.  I was hoping that was like.. An unspoken understanding.  I realized shortly afterwards it wasn't, so I wasn't upset about that.  I shouldn't make assumptions.  I asked her if she could bring each of us some more, and she said she would.  After that, she seemed very rush to get us out of there, which I understand.  I've severed and bartended and the amount of money you make is usually correlated with how quickly you can turn tables, but we had not been there that long, and I wasn't finished yet.  After she brought us our first refill of fries we were both sitting there without any drinks, and she says, "Can I get you guys some to go drinks?" Maybe she legit wanted us to take some with us, but it seemed more so that it was our que to leave.  For our second refill of fries, she only brought us one; my boyfriend didn't get any, even though we asked. Anyways, I was really underwhelmed and a little upset when I left.  I don't think I'll go back, which is sad because the food was good enough.

This is the second time we have tried Red Robin.  When we came in, at 4:15, we waited about 5 minutes to be seated when there was almost NO one there. Several servers looked at us with little concern.  Upon being seated, we waited for over 10 minutes to be greeted, only to see the couple who had been seated 5 minutes after us, got greeted and their drink order taken.  We were very disappointed, and promptly left, without even a single person addressing us on the way out.  Would not recommend.  Hops Burgers is a GREAT alternative and not far away!

I've been to this restaurant on several occasions and it seems that the food and service continues to get worse. We waited about 10 minutes before our waitress came over. She asked for our drink order, brought our drinks to our table and told us she would be back to take our order. Not sure why but we waited another 5 or so minutes before she returned to take our order. 30 minutes later we received our food. The whiskey wrap had way to much ranch dressing, and the French onion soup had so much salt you couldn't eat it. The manager came over and inquired on our food. I told him about the food issues and asked if he had tasted the soup. He offered a different soup which was better and took the wrap off our bill. I know they're  remolding the restaurant but I think they need to work on the basics, service and quality of food. I would rather spend my money on a good meal and service else where.

My gf and I thought we would give it a shot the other night and boy did we make a mistake.  Service was to quick at first and then none at the end.  Food was pretty rough. My burger tasted microwave and her "insane romaine" was terrible.  If you ever think about going there just keep on driving

Love the burger selections. If you're vegan/vegetarian they even have Boca patties for you. Their shakes are the best. So creamy and delicious and most dishes come with the option of bottomless fries!! Must try their campfire sauce.

They've changed the setup since I last visited. It now offers more privacy. No longer can you sit in the back of the restaurant and look straight through to the front. My food was delicious, as usual. I ordered a southern charm burger, no cheese & no mayo. My order came with both CHEESE & MAYO. The manager came and brought me a new burger & removed the charge from our bill. I would have preferred to eat with my dinner party but it was fine. I was shocked when my freckled lemonade, which is non-alcoholic, was $4.49. I think I was in an exceptionally good mood lol. Ooh well, It's still one of my fav restaurants & I'll be back.

I am writing this Yelp to you while sitting on my toilet in shear agony and pain. This restaurant has many problems and few qualities that make me want to return. Our waiter looked like she fell in a tackle box due to her extreme amount of piercings which made me uninterested in eating. Her General hygiene was just appalling and disgusting, nothing personal to her however a well run restaurant would have some type of restrictions on how many hooks you can have through your nose. Now the food was good, my burger was thick and juicy (wink, wink). The steak fries were also good, very steaky. Now my last problem was the drinks. My dr.Pepper was obviously watered down and after the waitress brought me two I decided to just get sweet tea. But wait there's more! It was unsweet tea because I guess they didn't think they could make my experience worse. Never coming back.
Hands down best server ever! Feven gets 5 GOLD Stars! Food very good too with best guacamole I've tried in GSO.
Walked in and sat down immediately. Then had to wait 45 minutes for food. For one burger and chicken tenders. Server was great, wasn't her fault. But dear lord, don't come here on a time constraint.

mwh,.. is right,... Average burger with lots of fries if you put pressure on the server. Plates and accessories specially picked to make the sparse portions look more important. Ridiculous prices for frozen hamburger patties at over ten dollars per plate and "special" offers if you buy one, get one half off. Good birthday program, free burger on birthday.

I went here for lunch today after coming form the doctors office.  I walked in, and had to stand around for about 5-6 mins before anyone acknowledged me, even though the waitresses kept looking over at me.  Finally a lady came over and took my order.  I ordered a chicken sandwich, chili cheese fries, and a drink.  I waited for my food a good 25 minutes before it was brought to me.  Let me add that this place was not busy at all either! After all of this, upon leaving I had tomatoes on my sandwich, which I asked them to be taken off.  The chili has big beans in it, and the fries were nasty honestly.  The price of the food is not worth what you get by far.  The customer service was horrible! I ordered a crispy chicken sandwich, chili cheese fries, and a drink that costed me 16.83 with tax.  I will probably never eat at a Red Robin again.

We went last night to Red Robin in Greensboro, and they said it would be a 20-25 minute wait, and that was okay. So we waited, after 15 minutes we saw many people leaving, 20 minutes and more people leaving, after 30 minutes goes by even more people have left after they got through with their dinner, but there was only a few people that were let in to be seated.  Now 40-minutes have gone by, so I got up and went to an area where I could view the dinning areas, and about 40% of all the tables and booths were cleaned and empty, so I asked them if they had a shortage of servers for all the tables, and after a few minutes they  finally told me that the kitchen wasn't able to keep up, so they were slowing down letting people in to be seated, and they couldn't tell us how much longer we'd have to wait before being seated. So after waiting 45-minutes, with no information as to how much longer of a wait time there would be, we decided to leave and we found some other place to eat super. This was a Friday night around 7:30, one of their busiest days of the week, and they couldn't keep up with just over 50% of their seated guests. I've been to this same place many times in the past and there was a reasonable small wait time, and never have I experienced anything like what I just experienced last night. I have to assume there's been a change in management. The staff should have inform the people waiting that they were experiencing issues in the kitchen and there waiting times may be a little longer, and let the people decide if they wanted to wait longer or leave, instead of continuing to tell everyone coming in that there is a 25-30 minute wait time.

This is a generous rating only because the server tried so hard to make up for the bad aspects of this visit. Took forever to get service, the food was marginal and came out really late. Perhaps the most annoying thing is that a manager, who kept tapping a tablet that I assume had the seating chart on it, was oblivious to how poorly the kitchen and service was working. He kept staring at his tablet and never took charge of the kitchen. Very poorly run and managed. Our first and last visit.
Takes too long to get a 2nd order of bottomless fries. It is a gimmick - false advertising - they wait you out. Meaning you are finished when you get the 2nd order. Service is bad bad bad
Found a hair in my salad manager took salad off of my receipt but made me pay for my onion rings and drink which I don't think I should've paid anything

This place is not the best. Came in, and no wait. We sit down, and the server comes to the table saying I got to many tables, and seemed to not even care about us as a customer. Our food get there, and my boyfriend ordered a chicken item, and it was BEEF. Manager seemed to care about the issue, but took to long to take action over it.
Awesomeness! Compliments to the Chefs!! The food was SUPURB!! Our Server was very efficient!!    The Nachos by far were the best we've had in a very long time! This is our FAVORITE RESTAURANT!!!

Went there today for lunch. Had a wonderful experience. Sat in the bar area, my waiter, I think his name was Billy, was very busy... but he still made time to give me great service! My food came out in a good amount of time and was delicious! I always order the Royal burger, never disappoints. He saw my sweet potato fries getting low and asked if I wanted more even before I could ask for more.  I went to my car thinking, that was a very pleasant experience! I, and my, belly was happy!

I have never been a Red Robin fan, but after coming here several times with my coworkers, I am a convert. I really like coming to this place and I usually enjoy the food and the great service. I really have fallen in love with their grilled cheese sandwiches though, and I tend to order that with their French Onion soup, which is delicious.  The service here is excellent, and was on display recently when I had an issue with mold on my sandwich which I spotted and alerted the waitress about. This issue was rectified and the sandwich was replaced free of charge, though I couldn't really eat the second one because the chef put too much pepper on it which rendered it inedible. I didn't say anything because I didn't want to be seen as the guy who keeps sending his sandwiches back . I was very disappointed on that day. On a positive note, I did receive the meal free of charge, though I still paid for my appetizer.   I'm trying not to dock this place another star because the other visits were fantastic, but I'm more skeptical now, given my recent experience. On a positive note, I came up with a short jingle to honor my recent patronage to this establishment: Green Robin is the place to be If botulism is your fantasy

Today was my first time dining at RR. I had the Guacamole Bacon Burger; it was well cooked (a little pink like I like it) juicy, tasty, loaded with flavor and almost too much for one person. I enjoyed the endless salad and my daughter had the endless fries. Our birthday burgers!  Our server, DeAndre was exceptional. He explained the menu in detail, gave us tips about how to change things up if we wanted, showed us how to use the tabletop technology,  was attentive to our needs (drinks and side seconds) and took care of us!  He was the very best server we have had at ANY restaurant (fast food to fine dining) in a long time. I will be back again.

Ok they were so nice to invite me back to get the birthday celebration started! Had the Red Tavern Double with a twist! I added pepper jack cheese and avocado. It was served with its never ending fries. Was served nice and hot and their Original Seasoning topped them off great! Wonderful service and attentive staff made it a successful outing! Because I signed up for for their Royalty Rewards Program, mine was #FREE! But, the others in my party enjoyed theirs just as much. But, don't take my word for it, try it for yourself! And the Sweet Treats Dessert was shared by all....
